problem_text: This is a GeomVerse problem. If the ABCDE shape is a combination of a rectangle and an equilateral triangle, the perimeter of the BAF triangle is 56, the CBGHI shape is a combination of a rectangle and an equilateral triangle and the area of the CBGHI shape is 114, compute the perimeter of the ABCDE shape. Round computations to 2 decimal places.
code:
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import matplotlib.patches as patches
import numpy as np

# Coordinates
A = (22034264.23, 10820164.23)
B = (34264.23, 10820164.23)
C = (34264.23, 34264.23)
D = (22034264.23, 34264.23)
E = (31375124.23, 5427214.2299999995)
F = (1761534.23, 21683704.23)
G = (-7965735.77, 10820164.23)
H = (-7965735.77, 34264.23)
I = (-3965735.77, -6893935.7700000005)

# Create figure and axis
fig, ax = plt.subplots(figsize=(12, 8))

# Draw the cyan polygon (A, B, C, D, E)
cyan_polygon = patches.Polygon([A, B, C, D, E], closed=True, color='cyan', alpha=0.6)
ax.add_patch(cyan_polygon)

# Draw the yellow triangle (B, A, F)
yellow_triangle = patches.Polygon([B, A, F], closed=True, color='yellow', alpha=0.6)
ax.add_patch(yellow_triangle)

# Draw the purple polygon (C, B, G, H, I)
purple_polygon = patches.Polygon([C, B, G, H, I], closed=True, color='purple', alpha=0.6)
ax.add_patch(purple_polygon)

# Draw right-angle markers
def draw_right_angle(ax, p1, p2, p3, size=1.0, color="gray", alpha=0.8):
    '''Draw a right-angle marker at the corner defined by p1, p2, and p3.'''
    v1 = np.array(p1) - np.array(p2)
    v2 = np.array(p3) - np.array(p2)
    v1 = v1 / np.linalg.norm(v1) * size
    v2 = v2 / np.linalg.norm(v2) * size
    marker = patches.Polygon(
        [p2, p2 + v1, p2 + v1 + v2, p2 + v2],
        closed=True,
        facecolor=color,
        edgecolor=None,
        alpha=alpha
    )
    ax.add_patch(marker)

# Add right-angle markers
draw_right_angle(ax, C, B, A)
draw_right_angle(ax, D, C, B)
draw_right_angle(ax, G, B, C)
draw_right_angle(ax, H, G, B)

# Add labels
ax.text(A[0], A[1], "A", fontsize=16, ha="right", va="bottom")
ax.text(B[0], B[1], "B", fontsize=16, ha="right", va="bottom")
ax.text(C[0], C[1], "C", fontsize=16, ha="right", va="top")
ax.text(D[0], D[1], "D", fontsize=16, ha="left", va="top")
ax.text(E[0], E[1], "E", fontsize=16, ha="left", va="bottom")
ax.text(F[0], F[1], "F", fontsize=16, ha="right", va="bottom")
ax.text(G[0], G[1], "G", fontsize=16, ha="right", va="bottom")
ax.text(H[0], H[1], "H", fontsize=16, ha="right", va="top")
ax.text(I[0], I[1], "I", fontsize=16, ha="right", va="top")

# -- LENGTH ANNOTATION -- #
ax.text((B[0] + F[0]) / 2, (B[1] + F[1]) / 2, "11", fontsize=16, ha="right", va="center")
ax.text((A[0] + F[0]) / 2, (A[1] + F[1]) / 2, "23", fontsize=16, ha="left", va="center")
ax.text((B[0] + G[0]) / 2, (B[1] + G[1]) / 2, "8", fontsize=16, ha="center", va="bottom")

# Configure the plot
ax.set_xlim(-14965735.77, 35034264.23)
ax.set_ylim(-9965735.77, 25034264.23)
ax.set_aspect("equal")
ax.axis("off")

# Show the plot
plt.show()

ext_info.cot: The lengths of the BF and AF sides of the BAF triangle are 11 and 23 and the perimeter is 56, so the lengths of the AB side equals $56 - 11 - 23 = 22$. The area of the CBGHI shape is 114 and the length of the BG side of its rectangle is 8, so $OtherSide * 8 + \frac{\sqrt{3}}{4} * 8^2 = 114$, so $OtherSide * 8 = 114 - \frac{\sqrt{3}}{4} * 8^2 = 114 - \frac{1.73}{4} * 64 = 114 - 0.43 * 64 = 114 - 27.52 = 86.48$. Therefore, the length of the BC side is $\frac{86.48}{8} = 10.81$. The side of the equilateral triangle in the ABCDE shape is equal to the side of the rectangle with length 10.81 so the shape has two rectangle sides with length 22, one rectangle side with length 10.81, and two triangle sides with lengths 10.81 so its perimeter becomes $2 * 22 + 3 * 10.81 = 44 + 32.43 = 76.43$. Therefore the final answer is 76.43.
